comments.name: Roger T. B.
comments.title: "The most versatile construction software."
text: I like this system because it is one of the most complete and versatile I have used, it allows me to gather all the information about its different modules in an organized way. It has a very eye-catching and friendly interface, it is necessary before carrying out the management of this system to be able to take the training process offered by the technical support team, in order to be able to take advantage of all the functions offered by that system.

At the moment this system is very useful for my business and I do not have any type of complaints regarding its functions, everyone in my company we are very satisfied with the use of this system.

comments.name: Joey Z.
comments.title: "User experience in this program is horrible"
text: I just spend about 10 mins and I could not come up with anything that I "like" about Procore. Literally nothing come into my mind at all. However, once you jump on board it will be so hard to get rid of it or trust any other developer. Good thing is they always have a customer experience team that can explain to you why something does not work and they are fully aware of it.

User experience is so bad. Every time I use procore it feels like I am using something from 10 years ago. As I said, their team will explain to you why something does not work and they knew about it but there will be no fix for it. You will just have to go around it which makes me feel really stupid. Most of the time is to delete everything possible and restart. Not what I am looking for.
To show owner that we have this so it feels like you are qualified. But these days, more and more owner respond with "oh god" when we mention this.

comments.name: Caleb P.
comments.title: "Create efficient engineering projects"
text: The drawing tool to review and track the drawings that are currently being designed and also for those that have been previously designed, this serves to have control over the designs that have been created or are being created and to be able to make modifications in real time.

It has a shipping tool that allows sending contractors to perform specific tasks in the company. Through this tool they are specified what needs to be done so they know what tasks they should address. It is really useful for business outsourcing.
Daily records serve to keep track of tasks and jobs developed within the company and serve to analyze them later and see if changes should be made.

To modify the font and size of the text in the drawing tool you must use a long bar that is inside this tool to make those changes. I think that this process could be simplified by changing the way we add and modify the text.

When you save some new person inside a directory and leave an unfilled field, when saving is deleted and you must start everything from the beginning. It would be easier to save all the information that has already been filled and then have to fill in what is missing, the procedures would be streamlined because when you add many people too late if you make a mistake.

Procore helps you to design more easily constructions in your company, so that external contracting is easier to do and also to keep track of the work done. It is a tool that increases the contol on those elements.

It has helped us a lot to design new constructions for our warehouse, since with its tools it is much simpler to edit and you can make any changes quickly, without having to recreate everything from scratch if there is an error or Design flaw

We have a simpler control of the tasks and jobs that each employee and part of the company has carried out, which helps us to have control over what our employees do and the achievement of our objectives.

comments.name: Gonzalo J.
comments.title: "Great tool for construction documentation"
text: 1. Very easy to enter information and easy to learn.
2. Useful with construction people often not so "computer friendly".
3. The notifications for overdue or expired items keep everyone informed and aware of the important things that need to be completed.
1. Needs more work on cross-referencing information.

2. A stand-alone version could help with projects with limited or slow Internet access, very common in projects in remote areas. That way, information could be entered immediately and then later uploaded when better a better Internet connection is available.

Consider availability of Internet access in the projects you intend to use the software as it will not work stand alone. The strength of the software relies on a good Internet connection; otherwise, it becomes frustrating to use.
1. Making sure that projects are adequately documented. We have made keeping all records completed a requirement for the approval of monthly invoices.
2. Making it easy to manage RFI, Submittals and other instruments that require multiple levels of review.

comments.name: Amber T.
comments.title: "Great Project Management Software!"
text: The submittal features are amazing for me! It made tracking submittals and O & M documents so much easier for me to find when needed. Also being able to look at plans and specs remotely was very helpful. The customer service is amazing and all of the staff trainings were planned out. It is just hard in the construction world to get construction workers that never look at the computer or use apps to pick up this software and use it.

Procore is a very expensive product. With small projects it is really not needed. When trying to save money and going from Submittal Exchange it really did not help very much. It felt like I was constantly walking the guys through their processes. When they needed to look up something I would have to walk them through every time. There really needs to be more trainings geared towards the construction worker that does not use electronics on a regular basis. Our guys in the field feel that it is easier to pick up a set of plans and look at them than it is to try and look the app over on their phone. The app had too many bugs for them to use. For the app the sumbittal software was limitied so when working remotly I had to use a computer not a cell phone or tablet. It is good, but it really does not save our company any money or time, when I am having to walk the guys through every step of the way.
This software needs to be budgeted into jobs better. When trying to cut overhead in our office this was one of the first things to go.
Tracking Tracking Tracking! This is great software to keep a record of documents and reference them from anywhere at anytime.

comments.name: Jeff M.
comments.title: "Good web-base software to manage project documents"
text: Procore does a good job of bringing all of the different construction document administration tasks into one centralized tool that is organized, collaborative, and easy for new users to pick up on. The developers of the software seem to receive feedback from users and update regularly to improve tools and change interfaces to better suit the customer. Overall Procore seems to be the benchmark company for construction document control, and is heading in the right direction.

Some parts or tools of Procore are still a little bulky and may be difficult on a spotty construction internet connection. Submittal logs, RFI registers and some of the drawings may take a little bit of time to load on your computer due to the way Procore draws up their lists.
Procore's marketing and BD team seems to be very well in tuned with customer needs. I'm sure they offer trials or demo's to those considering Procore.
Procore has made document management easy for commercial construction.

comments.name: Kenneth P.
comments.title: "Procore, a software with a lot to offer"
text: The ease of sorting documents, RFI, PCO's, Drawings, sub lists, etc.

One thing that I dislike is that you cant sync multiple accounts together. Being able to sync between accounts helps alleviate the need of having to ask or reach out to different individuals looking for certain items that only a specific person has access to. This would make the software a little more user friendly as there have been many times where myself or co-workers were looking to access documents like PCO's or RFI's and we are not able to view them regardless of the permissions set by the contractor. This delayed us when it came to approving off on certain documents as we were unable to access them in a timely manner. I think it should be considered, if not done so already, to allow multiple users or accounts to sync together so information can be more easily communicated.
Make sure to focus during the live training sessions, it is not difficult to pick up, but a lot of information is passed down.

We are not able to utilize Procore like we want to without being able to sync between our account and the contractors. Making it difficult to keep up/track certain documents. A benefit I have realized is when not counting on the ability to sync between accounts, it is easy to keep track of your own documents by having them all in one easily accessible location.

comments.name: Bethany L.
comments.title: "Great Program, but a little pricey"
text: Procore is a great tool that helps our company to keep all of our information in one place. We are able to integrate records from the majority of other programs to minimize the number of times that we have to repeat steps. Our subcontractor invoicing is very efficient as well and allows for subs to quickly bill. I love that Procore is always making improvements based on suggestion and is willing to help us create what we need in order to have a smooth running system. Their staff helps us to customize the features to align with our processes versus us having to rework our entire workflow to match a program.

Procore is one of the more expensive systems that we have utilized. In order to get all of the functionality, you often have to purchase more than one subscription with various add-ons. We often have to get subscriptions to other programs for the missing information. Wish the management system had estimating and scheduling software included.

It is important to research beforehand what subscriptions are needed for your company, but we love the Procore Sync functionality that functions like Dropbox and allows subs to upload items into the folders you give them access to.

Procore is consistently a work in progress, but it has helped us to create more standardization in the company. It has increased collaboration and dissemination of information, increased accountability and transparency, and has centralized data storage allowing employees, owners, and subs to access information on different devices and platforms whether working in the office or field.

comments.name: K G.
comments.title: "Procore is a great tool for our day to day project management needs"
text: I like having everything project related tracked and managed within one program.
The ability to integrate with Spectrum is great.
The interface is all very user friendly and intuitive.
I really like being able to suggest changes and then track the implementation.
Off the top of my head, some areas for improvement would be:
The ability to distribute a submittal package instead of each individual submittal would be great.
Creating a submittal register is VERY time consuming and tedious.
It would be very helpful to see a user's permission template on the directory page without having to click edit.
The way specifications and drawings are handled with Procore has solved a lot of issues we were having with the organization of drawing sets, revisions, sketches, etc.

Our company ran into some problems with submittals. There were some long delays, losing track of submittals, he said/she said of submittals being turned in or not. With Procore, there is a lot less risk of lost or delayed submittals. The data is all tracked so there's no way to say something did or didn't come in without Procore having the evidence of it.

The scheduled report distribution has been great in many ways. Since the superintendents need to have their information logged before the report goes out , we have seen a big improvement in the timeliness of the daily reports.

comments.name: Neree G. C.
comments.title: "How Procore has changed the way the industry does business!"
text: The most powerful part of Procore is the collaboration it cultures between all the departments of our company. The combination of mobile software, integrations, and the web allows every member of the project team to communicate information in real time. This in turns allows for more time actually managing the project and reducing the time commitment of team members administrative responsibilities.

My role is solely to implement and facilitate the use of Procore within our company. Procore has made helpful how to documents, training videos, and online courses available to all its users. The biggest challenge I find is that quite often users have no idea these resources exist. This leads to frustration with the product, an unwillingness to adopt, or the product not being maximized to its fullest potential. .

Procore is an excellent construction management software! The biggest gains we have found have been with our teams in the field. The mobile tools have allowed us to quickly communicate and track issues between employees and subcontractors all in one collaborative place. Here in Australia we have had some challenges with the financial tools, but back in the US those tools work very well. In addition, there are many API integrations available to help meet your company's needs (Docusign, MS Project, P6, ect). In my opinion, no matter the size of your company, Procore can improve your business, promote transparency between organizations, and save you money.

Improving the communication between the site and management has allowed our Project Managers to gain a better picture of their project while not having to be physically on site. In addition, the tool is allowing our site teams to better track and call out any issues in order to ensure that our punch list and additional costs are minimized. I am also hoping to make the switch to the Training Center in the coming months to improve how we direct our employees on how to use the product.

comments.name: Mike P.
comments.title: "Intuitive, user friendly, and great support; Procore"
text: The ability to share documents and large files without making customers create another account for a service that they will only use for a short duration project.

The amount of work required to get drawings into the drawing tool, I do however understand the necessity of the process. The tool is very powerful and if you can afford the time to add drawings properly you can accomplish a lot of useful time saving tasks.
Contact their team. They can tailor a package specifically to meet your needs.

The greatest benefit that we have realized the quickest is that some of the agencies we deal with do not allow registration to outside file sharing sites (i.e. dropbox) that require accounts. They also lack the ability to receive files larger than 5 meg. This is a problem because most of our smallest reports exceed the limit. Procore has no size limit and does not require users to "register".

comments.name: Internal Consultant
comments.title: "Procore Review"
text: The best thing about it is its ease of use and convenience. It is easy enough to figure out how to use. We've had a number of otherwise resistant individuals who were able to get over the hurdle of the learning curve and have learned to like it
The software is on the expensive side. The price tag for Procore as a percentage of project dollar volume in terms of a yearly expenditure can be a tough commitment to face.

As is the case with any software implementation, you definitely need to have a plan in place. Procore offers a lot of help in this area and will aid in guiding you through the process. But you will want to have the right processes and people in place internally to help maximize your success. Not having the right people on the bus and in the right seats will only aid the resistance to change.
Documentation of submittals, RFIs, issues, photos, drawings

comments.name: Administrator
comments.title: "Real Time Project Management Onsite or Off"
text: The ability to see up to date information real time whether we're on site or off. Sharing of data, drawings and scheduling is easy and notifications are a click away for the team.
Can lag at times and the directory could use some upgrades.

Procore provides the ability to have all your project, contact and scheduling information in one location, assists you in tracking your costs, meetings, communications and more at a click of the mouse. Whether onsite or in the office, each team member will have access to all the data, be able to update as needed, add photos, upload documents and drawings and share information easily. A great tool for a Project Manager freeing up time to focus on the Project not the administrative part and paperwork.
We are able to analyze each project, see where we need to focus and adjust on costs and time for the next. It helps us become better Project Managers and General Contractors.

comments.name: Ben C.
comments.title: "Great for subcontractors"
text: Procore easily allows our most important resource, our workers in the field, to always have access to the most up to date drawings and specifications. I never have to worry about re-work due to outdated drawings anymore.
With notifications, I, along with my team in the filed, can quickly see any issues that we need to take care of. Procore also allows us to easily respond back showing the fix!

The iOS app for the iPhone, needs to be streamlined. It can be clunky, and take time to get to a certain drawing. When you have a large amount of files/drawings in a project, it can take quite a bit of time to load it as well.
If you are a subcontractor, I would recommend waiting until a GC or CM requires it, or offers it for free to all users on a large project.
It saves time for our field leaders to go back to look at a set of drawings. No matter where they are located on a project, they always have access to all of the drawings, for all trades

comments.name: chelsea s.
comments.title: "ProCore Survey"
text: We have 2 branches to our company (one located in Hawaii and the other in LA). We use Procore for both branches to keep track of projects and to pass along important documents. We also use it to issue Contracts, Sub-contracts, Changes Orders, etc. Procore allows us to easily provide our clients with one place to find all their documents (plans, contracts, contact information, etc), which would otherwise be lost within tons of emails.

The online video demonstrations of how to use all of ProCores tools can be a little hard to watch. It's not that the videos are particularly difficult to understand, but the aren't the most stimulating thing to sit through and watch. They tried their best to break it down by providing quizzes and shorter videos, but when you look at how much material there is to learn in one course, it's daunting.
Making the learning process easier. Clients and subcontractors generally don't have the time it takes to learn ProCore--which makes it difficult to encourage them to use.
Manages and uploads plans to one place and allows for drawing edits for all appropriate parties to see.
Allows users to make changes to things that have been submitted, while also automatically informing all appropriate parties of the changes.
Sends reminders to clients and subcontractors about answering RFIs that would otherwise have been forgotten about.

comments.name: Steven S.
comments.title: "Fantastic Software"
text: The drawings tool is brilliant, the functions and features available save so much time working.
The software is still US based and there are various elements which are not so relevant to the UK industry or are missing, such as a dedicated CVI tool.

We have had difficulties getting the companies we work with to fully commit to using the system so it advised to set up workshops and try to be strict upon its implementation across the board on projects.
Procore keeps track of everything for us and we have certainty that all documents and emails are stored and available at anytime. It provides so much additional security.

comments.name: User
comments.title: "Best out of the Box Option"
text: Procore includes all the project managment tools you need to effectively manage a project. The web based software takes the place of many of the old spreadsheets that we would typically keep for a project. The support is wonderful as they allow you options to chat, e-mail, and phone 24 hours a day.

As the software is out of the box there are some tools that don't work quite like I'd like them to. I wish we could customize things a little more. We were fairly early adopters of the software and it felt like earlier on they would cater more to your individual company. Now that there bigger I don't think they can do that.
Unless you want to design something from scratch this would be the way to go.
RFI logs, submittal logs, change order tracking, drawing logs, benefits include time savings, less duplicate entries, and less holes in the process as things are run more smoothly through procore.

comments.name: Chris H.
comments.title: "a VDC/BIM perspective"
text: The simple concepts that everything you need is at your fingertips and everyone is reading the same sheet of music (as long as you have internet access). These simple concepts are half the battle; if adhered to it allows clarity of information, accountability, meaningful collaboration.

It's expensive and I've found some features in other products that I would like to see in Procore. If you are trying to be a one stop shop, it's important to either keep up with the Joneses or at least have them consider you family. That way you can get rid of your other software and defer the additional costs for Procore.

It's expensive, If you even plan to test it out, really learn and utilize it. Watch videos and buy into their community. This isn't a dip your toes in software or you may not get back the value of your investment.

What's being solved is the issue of dated software and processes. Procore exists in the now with current main stream technology such as cloud computing, OCR, API integration, online collaboration, etc... The benefit is that from on site meetings to conference calls, to off site meetings, all the information I need for my project is accessible and can be quickly referenced.

text: 1) The drawings automatically pull the most current to the front.
2) Accessibility from the field
3) Financials

You can get lost in the rabbit hole so to speak. There is so much and it goes so deep. If there were more individual classes offered for training that would be stupendous. The training videos are a great resource but it's hard to retain such a wealth of information in one sitting.

comments.name: Jeffrey Y.
comments.title: "Procore is very ineffective"
text: Everyone in this office and everyone on the contractor side hates procore because it is very hard to use. Transmittal feature sucks too because you have to "add" the document after you already uploaded it.

Everything. I had a lot of issues with Procore since day 1 of using it. I contacted the design team and support team but nothing could be resolved. I was given excuses of saying it is impossible to make the changes I am asking and that I have no right to make any request for changes as I am ONLY a project admin . ONLY the COMPANY admin can make request changes but the Company admin rarely uses Procore on a daily basis. The project admins use Procore on a daily basis and cant make any requests. My request to me is very simple because all I asked for is to make sure that if the RFI or Submittal signature line at the bottom to be on the same page as the rest of the content. As the issue is that 99% of the content when printed out is on page 1 but the signature and only the signature line is on page 2. This looks very weird and I asked for this to be fixed. There were also many things I asked for such as multiple reviewer to be assigned in as Ball in Court for RFI and other features I deem as important to my job. Every time I ask i was denied or asked to put it in as an idea. After a year none of these issues have been resolved and procore is still very not flexible.

Load screen is very slow, implementation is very slow, very hard to use, not flexible, pay app is hard to modify especially if changes were done on a previous pay app or new modifications of the scope.

We are the construction managers of this project but we don't see any benefit of Procore. The only reason we use procore is because we are told to use it. We only use it to track official documents and nothing else.

comments.name: Celeste L.
comments.title: "Streamlines work, increases communication"
text: I really like the ability of Procore to link to Quickbooks as well as the ability to track RFI's, submittals, emails for a job all in one place. I think for such a complex program, it's very user friendly...even for our not so tech savvy employees.

We are a small, but growing quickly company, and I wish that there was a way to go back and redo some things...where we started is not where we need to be (cost codes for instance), and we've learned so much and changed some of plans and practices, it would be nice to be able to have a clean state for new projects.
Go thru all of the tutorials, they are so helpful in utilizing all of Procore's features

Our biggest challenge is getting vendors/customers on board with utilizing Procore. Most are very receptive and jump on board quickly, but a few insist on working outside of Procore, and then we are forced into entering the information in Procore separately. The benefits for our company have been huge...we've been awarded some large projects, and I honestly don't know how we'd track them without Procore.

comments.name: Bryan W.
comments.title: "Drawings, Specifications and RFI tools are fantastic!"
text: - Making their software very user friendly. Pretty easy to learn, and customizable to fit our needs.
- Providing excellent customer support, where the people are always friendly, and readily available (not a 15 minute hold time away).
- Developing an easy platform to navigate large project drawing books quickly, compare drawing revisions, and make notes on the drawings.
- It's expensive and may be hard to justify for smaller construction companies.
- Their OCR still has trouble reading "handwriting" fonts, which can really slow down the drawing uploading process.

- Their Drawing system will not flip pages within a PDF. Occasionally, a GC will send us the pages turned portrait instead of landscape, and we have to use third party software to flip the pages the correct orientation.

Procore is well suited for any construction industry business, making it simple to keep all of your project documents and budget handling all in one place. As I mention a lot in this review, the Drawings, Specifications, and RFI tools help make our job a lot easier, and, from what I understand from our other departments, the budget management tools work very well for what they need them to do. The downside, again, is that it is expensive, and a construction industry business would have to be doing quite a bit of projects, in my opinion, to justify the cost.
- Saves time in sorting drawings and specifications.
- Saves time in compiling drawing notations for RFIs.
- Saves time in being able to quickly compare drawing revisions, and confirm which revision is the most recent.

comments.name: Van R. J.
comments.title: "Procore"

comments.name: Spencer D.
comments.title: Procore Year End Review
text: Comments: Emails generated by Procore seem to get ignored more often than not and I believe this is due to their generic nature. For instance, if I am a subcontractor sitting at my computer and I get a Procore notification (or dozens), I don't know if its a submittal request, an invitation to bid, or an update to the drawings. And if i'm getting dozens of these notifications each day, it becomes difficult to prioritize. I've noticed that subcontractors are much more willing to respond to a personal email than to a Procore email. It would be helpful if a Procore notification could more closely resemble a regular email. Who it's from, the subject, short and sweet.

Pros: Procore's construction management tools are both easy to use and functional. Some of the best features that come to mind are the Drawing tool's ability to keep track of current drawings while still being able to review superseded drawings, the Submittal tool's ability to assign submittals to subcontractors so that they know exactly what is required and when it is expected by, and the Punchlist tool's ability to simplify the tracking process and even pinpoint each item to a specific location on the drawings.

Cons: All construction companies have a different way of doing things but Procore, in a way, forces everything to be done a certain way. If you try and tweak things to mimic your company's way of doing things, it may break some of the automated functionality within the software which may cause a lack of continuity and create the potential for user error. Also, some of the tools could use some major improvements. The Drawing tool's markup options are great but they are inconsistent. For instance, when adding text, the only way to change the font size is with a slider bar which makes it difficult to keep things consistent. Also, would it be possible to get a copy and paste feature? The Directory tool is great at keeping companies and users organized and it would be incredibly helpful for companies to add some custom features. For instance, my company likes to track how many employees a company might have, and the states that they are willing to work but there isn't a good way of noting this.

comments.name: Paul B.
comments.title: Comprehensive Project Management System
text: Comments: I have worked in residential home construction, single & multifamily construction, multifamily affordable housing, mixed use, and commercial construction projects. I have worked on projects ranging from less than 1K to over 16M. Procore is outstanding for all but small single-family residential projects...I could make Procore work like a charm for this type of construction, but it would take some creativity.

Pros: Daily Logs are easily completed and sent to the appropriate parties. This means they actually get done which means they are more accurate. Adding photos to the logs is very easy as well. Procore allows you to put links to photos on your drawing set. This is especially helpful when we send out bid packages...bidders can see more details and existing conditions for our commercial remodeling projects. If you need to send out a lot of requests for quotes, Procore makes it easy to keep track of everything through the Reports function. PM's can also drill down to see who has or has not opened the invitation...a real time saver! Procore has a submittal builder built in, so after you upload the spec book, you can click on the builder and it generates a list of possible submittals. You can modify the list to suit your need. This can save days on a large project. When you upload revised drawing pages, Procore allows you to overlay the pages and highlights the differences with the new set. This is very helpful even if you were aware of the coming changes. It also allows you the chance to note the changes for possible change orders.

Cons: I'd like to see the ability to more with the mark-up tool. Features that are available on simple take-off software would be nice. Something as simple as being able to place a color-coded dot would be helpful. When adding people to the directory, it would be nice if when you forget to complete one of the required fields and hit SAVE...rather than delete everything because you forgot that one step...it'd be nice to just give you a message asking you to "please enter missing information". The way is now, seems rather punitive, but I'm sure they will change it. I'd like to see other types of scheduling options become compatible with Procore. I do use MS Project, but not everyone does. Project is rather pricey and would be another software product to learn.

comments.name: Verified Reviewer
comments.title: I am a construction project manager for a multi-family construction general contractor.
text:
Pros: I have used the software previously as a subcontractor and now working for a general contractor. Procore keeps all necessary construction documentation in one, easy to access place with no space restrictions. It can be utilized offline for those out of the way projects. Once the system is understood and practiced, it is quite useful. Sometimes my office is 500+ miles away from the jobsite. I can be on the phone with my superintendent, looking at the same documents while on the phone discussing the issue. Submittals and RFI can be turned around in a day (if all team members are paying attention and on board with Procore.) I can have owners included on the system with limited access to photos and reports. Everyone in our office uses Procore; project managers, coordinators, AP, AR, and directors. I remember how we used to do everything with hard copies and ship back and forth between team members. Procore speeds up the process and streamlines everything.

I also had to sit through depositions for a project that went wrong, 6 years after the project was completed. All of the evidence was either printed emails, or hard copies of daily reports, pictures, etc. I feel like I would have been better covered and better represented if I had all of my documents organized within the system and structure of Procore.

Cons: While Procore is a great system, it is a complicated system and takes some time and training to adopt and master. Like any other program, Procore can only be as good as the data and information uploaded. I find it most difficult to get architects and engineers on board initially. Once on board, most of them question why they were so reluctant, but it is almost always a process. Subcontractors are very similar, although many of our subcontractors still fax over using email.
Overall: It saves time, collects a ton of data into one place, and there are no limits on size.

comments.name: Brian H.
comments.title: Procore saved us from cobbled together Excel spreadsheets and poorly implemented SharePoint sites
text: Pros: As an Agile-led development team, Procore is constantly improving their product through extensive analytics and actual customer feedback. This is a process I've witnessed first hand. In terms of the product, Procore integrates all the key tools needed for managing projects in the built environment. In addition, the product helps reinforce best practices in construction project management, which coming from a forensic expert, that's definitely a good thing when it comes to proactively managing risk. If more companies simply relied on tools like Procore for managing their projects, there would be a measurable decrease in claims, disputes and litigation.

Cons: Despite extensive multimedia training materials, Procore remains a very difficult tool for onboarding new employees. In addition, the Procore marketing materials didn't set proper expectations for the overhead required to implement Procore company-wide. Additionally, Procore has made the decision to really focus their tools and the language used for describing those tools on very specific roles - primarily general contractors, at-risk CMs with trade contractors and engineers occupying the second tier or class of clients. For agency CMs, architects, other consultants, etc., use of the product is somewhat different from how the documentation describes it.

Overall: Better clarity into the activities, documentation and critical information associated with our project, which number in the hundreds. Procore allows us to easily collaborate with our employees, outside members, other consultants, our clients, etc. Perhaps most importantly, Procore enables us to better serve our clients by keeping critical project information together in a trusted system. It has even enabled us to compete with much larger firms by showcasing the quality of work product produced from within Procore.

Creating user access templates and controlling or restricting access to certain areas of the platform is very easy. Individuals at all levels throughout the process are fairly easily able to understand what they need to do as it is very intuitive.

Cons: The user access setting need to be customizable at a lower level of detail, I would have rated five stars for Features & Functionality if it weren't for this. I find myself having to give people within the group full Administrative rights to tools in order for them to do what should be a task available at a lower level without full rights to change setup of the tool. If you aren't doing the same or extremely similar projects each and every time, there needs to be a Corporate level for reporting purposes and what they now have as "Company" level would be more the project level for those projects that are almost identical and/or being performed by the same project group. Changes made to the company level affect all the projects underneath that company and many settings are only at the Company level so if your projects aren't VERY similar to each other this may not work out well. In our case, Procore has managed a work around for this but it causes many of the executive dashboard functions to not work right. Limited customization but with a little ingenuity you can figure out ways to make things work.

Recommendations to other buyers: Pay close attention to your setup, think about if you will have (or might have) more than one project under your company because you will want to set up many items at the Project level instead of Company level. Procore is a great product and I highly recommend it as a very easy to use tool for controlling project documentation.
